definitions.title: n.[m.]
definitions.body: appar. a kind of rattle, only [[וּבִמְנַֽעַנְעִים]] 2Sa 6:5, in list of musical instruments; LXX ku/mbala, but this usu. (12 t.) = [[מְחִלְתַּיִם]]; Vulgate sisitra; the sistrum (Gr. sei=stron, fr. sei/w) was much used in Egypt; it was a small metal frame with loose metal bars carrying loose rings, borne and swung or shaken in the hand, v. Wilkinson:Anc. Kgyptians (1878), i. 497 ff. Now:Arch. l. 273 Benz:Arch. 278 We:Psalm Psalm Eng. Trans. p. 233.
